content: not quite vanilla by jennifer beaulieu option3 option1 to thank all of my followers who support my work by liking sharing and knitting my patterns i decided to make this pattern available for free this pattern is not quite vanilla because it has a small band of colorwork after the cuff and before the toe there are five different options for the colorwork band and i ve also included a mod to knit more than one band on the leg i had sock sets with a main color and one or two contrasting colors in mind when creating this pattern modusingoptions2and5 ©jenniferbeaulieu2024 patternforpersonaluseonly forquestions pleasecontactellyndriaknits@gmail com 1 sizes s m l to fit 7-7 5 8-8 5 9-9 5 or about 18-19 20-22 23-24 cm abbreviations circumferences k - knit p - purl yarn sl - slip_stitch purlwise mc 50-80g of fingering weight yarn k2tog - knit 2 together ssk - slip 1 stitch knitwise slip 1 more 1 or 2 ccs 20g of fingering weight yarn each stitch knitwise then knit both slipped stitches together through great for sock sets with contrasting colors the back loops bor - beginning of round ● if using an mc plus 2 ccs make sure cc - contrast color the ccs contrast with each other cc1 cc2 - contrast color 1 contrast color great option for wild or busy mcs 2 ● if using an mc plus 1 cc make sure mc - main color the cc contrasts well with the mc rs - right side ws - wrong side needles us size 1 / 2 25mm extras stitch marker tapestry needle share your socks on instagram with hashtag gauge 34 stitches and 44 row to 4 10cm #notquitevanilla worked in stockinette stitch in the round and please feel free to tag me happy knitting @ellyndria knits to knit the mod on the left between chart repeats add two cc rounds round 1 k all round 2 p all when knitting this mod it is good to monitor your cc usage by weighing the yarn ©jenniferbeaulieu2024 patternforpersonaluseonly forquestions pleasecontactellyndriaknits@gmail com 2 notes ● there are 5 options for the colorwork sections so you can choose your favorite i used option 1 for my sample sock in the bright rainbow color ● when working the colorwork sections my biggest tip is to knit it inside out to keep the floats long and increase the circumference of the float layer to do this push the cuff down inside and then continue knitting as normal except you ll be working on the needle furthest from you rather than the one closest to you a quick demonstration is found in the beginning of this short https //youtube com/shorts/duglhmgxftm if you would like a more in depth explanation there is a longer video on my channel about this when you complete the colorwork section turn the sock right side out again to continue knitting the rest of the sock ● my other tip for these colorwork sections is
